setPermission
The function allows to assign/restrict read/write/delete permissions to an object.
The function is executed
with system control of object permissions
. Read more about
permissions
.
Syntax
setPermission
(subject, obj, read, write, delete)
Setting
Purpose
subject
Security subject (System user or group of System users).
obj
Object(s) for which permission needs to be changed.
read
Permissions to read the object. The value is true/false.
write
Permissions to write the object. The value is true/false.
delete
Permissions to delete the object. The value is true/false.
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in the Algorithm Editor on the "Users and groups" tab.
This will open a modal window where the function parameter values can be set:
1. The
button will open a modal window for selecting security subjects (users/groups of users for which permissions are assigned/restricted). The selected security subjects will be displayed in the modal window for setting the setPermission function.
If the security subject is not selected, the
null
value will be set when the function construct is inserted in the algorithm code.
2.The object (objects) for which permissions should be changed is selected in the "Objects for which permissions can be changed" table.
If no object(s) is selected, the
null
value will be set when the function construct is inserted in the algorithm code.
3. Changing the read/write/delete permissions of the selected objects is configured using
buttons.
If permission is allowed, the value of the parameter will be set to
true
, if prohibited -
false
, to leave the existing one -
null
.
Example
User group
"Employee (Edu)"
when working with object type
"Division"
has to
